title: Goat Cheese, Valle d'Aosta Style
introduction: The Goat Cheese, Valle d'Aosta Style, also known as Tomini di Courmayeur, hails from the picturesque region of Courmayeur, known for its stunning ski resorts and a rich culinary heritage that straddles the French-Italian border. This delightful dish showcases mild goat cheese topped with a vibrant mixture of fresh herbs and crunchy celery, creating a perfect harmony of flavors that pairs wonderfully with toasted Italian or French bread. Whether served as an appetizer or a dessert drizzled with honey, it is a true testament to the simple yet flavorful cuisine of Valle d'Aosta.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
Thin slices toasted Italian or French bread

instructions.description: In a medium bowl, whisk together the oil, vinegar, garlic, thyme, red pepper, and salt and black pepper to taste. Stir in the celery, parsley, and sage.
Place the cheese on a serving plate. Pour the sauce over the cheese. Cover and let stand 1 hour at room temperature. Serve with toasted bread.
